title: What is non relativistic motion? - Quora

response.answer_text: First, understand the meaning of the word “Relativistic’’. A particle is said to be a relativistic particle if it moves with a speed comparable to the speed of light. So, the motion than describes such particles is called relativistic motion. Non-Relativistic motion therefore describes the motion of particles/objects that do not travel with a speed comparable to the speed of light.

Relativistic motion is defined as motions of speed which is comparable with speed of light, also known as relativistic speeds. Simply put, speed measured in thousands kilometres per second. Thus non-relativistic motion is motion with speeds of much lower magnitude, for example kilometres power hour.

Non relativistic motion means that your velocity is much much much less than the speed of light. At these everyday velocities, effects from relativity aren't noticeable and Newton’s Laws work perfectly well.

Non relativistic means speed of particle is very small compaired to light… and relativistic means speed is nearly to the speed of light… so motion with speed is very small compaired to light speed called non relativistic motion…

Motion itself is a relativistic quantity.Othetwise it have no absolute meaning like energy,time.But in the case when the motion is so less compare to the speed of light you may use Newtonian motion formula which is a very precise approximation instead of using Einstein's relativistic equation which must be required when something's motion reaches near to the speed of light.
